metadata.title: CVE-2018-10061 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Cacti before 1.1.37 has XSS because it makes certain htmlspecialchars callswithout the ENT_QUOTES flag (these calls occur when the html_escapefunction in lib/html.php is not used).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10061` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cacti - 1.1.38+ds1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cacti package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.38+ds1-1').
